intro: Oxytenanthera densa, commonly known as the dense thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has woody stems and produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Oxytenanthera densa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
